bug.short_desc: Upgrade trace-cmd to at least 2.2.4 and possibly to 2.5.x
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Port this bug to Fedora, as upstream is already 2.6 and there is already plan to update it in RHEL. +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1219852 +++
Description of problem:
We should either upgrade to 2.2.4 or to 2.5.x
Either one of these are minor version upgrades Both contain a number of fixes that we should apply.
2.5.x would be preferable. This is also incremental, but is more likely to be supported for back-porting patches.
--- Additional comment from John Kacur on 2016-06-27 10:49:33 EDT ---
Upgraded to trace-cmd-2.6.0 Complete in trace-cmd-2.6.0-2.el7 and up
trace-cmd-2.6-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1cdba6f2c8
trace-cmd-2.6-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-e437d0eff0

In rawhide.
In queue for f24, f25 updates-testing.

trace-cmd-2.6-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1cdba6f2c8
